info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 11:14PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield, Daniels, western Roosevelt, southeastern Valley, Sheridan and northwestern McCone Counties through 1215 AM MDT... At 1114 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Archer, or 12 miles northwest of Plentywood, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glasgow, Wolf Point, Plentywood, Scobey, Nashua, Fort Peck, Medicine Lake, Westby, Flaxville, Archer, Port Of Raymond, Duck Creek Rec Area, St. Marie, Peerless, Port Of Whitetail, Lustre, Madoc, Fort Peck Marina, Bredette and Port Of Scobey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
